basics.name: Jacob Aronoff
basics.summary: I'm a software engineer at Drift, where I work on making our platform more reliable. I worked for Datadog on their Alerting team as an intern in 2017, and as a co-op in 2018, where I developed Go and Python services using Kafka, elasticsearch, and Cassandra. I currently attend Northeastern University's College of Computer and Information Science as a Computer Science major. I serve as the president of [NU Hacks](https://nuhacks.io). I'm a hackNY 2017 fellow, and interact 2018 fellow. I served as a mentor for the hackNY fellowship program in 2018, planning a multitude of activities, speaker events, and projects. I'm the director for [hackNY's hackathon](https://hackny.org/hackathon/). Outside of work, [I love to cook, bake, and bartend](https://instagram.com/ehicouldeat), you can read more about that [here](https://ehicouldeat.com).

highlights: Engineered a system to automatically generate alerts for our production and QA systems
Designed Drift's game day process for reliability engineering, running multiple game days
Architected a process to automatically determine the health of a deployed build in multiple environments
Devised multiple schemes to load test new products at varying scales
Built a service that handles with millions of requests per day
Migrated a major pipeline dependency to an autoscaling group, using Kafka 10 for load balancing
Generated the first Swift mobile library for the Datadog API, called SwiftDog
Automated customer support by leveraging three seperate APIs in a microservice
Created micro services in Flask, Javascript, and Java
Updated the company wide testing suite

volunteer.summary: Plan and run the annual hackNY hackathon, the first collegiete hackathon
highlights: Organize volunteers and mentors to assist in the production of the event
Helped develop a ruby on rails service
Wrote multiple AWS Lambda functions to automate tasks

education.institution: Northeastern University, College of Computer and Information Science
education.studyType: Candidate for a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
courses: DS 4400 - Data Mining and Machine Learning
